title.rendered: How to Use Spandan 4.0: A Comprehensive Guide to Taking ECG at Home

Author:- Mr. Ritesh Sharma

Monitoring your heart health has never been easier, thanks to innovative devices like Spandan 4.0. This portable electrocardiogram (ECG) device allows you to record, store, and manage your heart’s electrical activity from the comfort of your home. In this guide, we’ll walk you through the process of using Spandan 4.0 to take an ECG, ensuring you get accurate readings and make the most of this valuable health tool.

Understanding Spandan 4.0

Spandan 4.0 is a point-of-care medical device designed to capture single-channel 12-lead ECG data. It works in conjunction with an Android mobile application, which serves as the interface for capturing, displaying, and managing your ECG data. The device connects to your smartphone via a micro-USB cable, allowing for seamless data transfer and real-time monitoring.

Preparing for Your ECG

Before you begin, ensure you have the following

  1. Spandan 4.0 device
  2. Android smartphone with the Spandan ECG app installed
  3. Micro-USB cable
  4. Chest electrodes and leads
  5. Alcohol prep pads or gauze with benzoin tincture (optional)


Choose a quiet, comfortable location with a stable temperature. It’s best to be relaxed and seated upright with your back straight during the test.

Step-by-Step Guide to Taking an ECG

  1. Download and Install the App:
    • Scan the QR code provided or search for “Spandan ECG” in the Google Play Store.
    • Install the application on your Android smartphone.
  2. Connect Spandan 4.0:
    • Use the micro-USB cable to connect the Spandan device to your smartphone.
  3. Enable OTG Connection:
    • Go to your phone settings and search for “OTG.”
    • Enable the OTG connection.
    • Return to the Spandan app.
  4. Prepare the Electrodes:
    • Clip the electrodes onto the provided chest leads.
    • Remove the plastic covering from the electrodes.
    • For better adhesion, you may clean the skin with an alcohol prep pad or gauze with benzoin tincture.
  5. Position the Electrodes: For males:
    • Place the Red chest lead on your right shoulder.
    • Place the Green chest lead on your left shoulder.
    • Position the Yellow chest lead as shown in the app’s guidance.
  6. For females:
    • Follow the same procedure, ensuring proper placement around the breast area as illustrated in the app.
  7. Record the 12-Lead ECG:
    • Follow the app’s instructions to move the Yellow chest lead through positions V1 to V6, and finally to Lead II.
    • After reaching Lead II, switch the position of the Green chest lead with the Yellow chest lead.
    • The app will guide you through each step, ensuring proper lead placement.
  8. Stay Still and Record:
    • Remain relaxed and still during the recording process.
    • The app will indicate when the recording is complete.
  9. Generate and Share Your Report:
    • Once the test is finished, the app will generate a report.
    • You can share this report with your healthcare provider via WhatsApp, email, or other digital platforms.


Interpreting Your ECG Results: While Spandan 4.0 provides you with ECG data, it’s crucial to remember that interpreting ECG results requires medical expertise. Always consult with a qualified healthcare professional to understand your ECG results and their implications for your heart health.

Maintaining and Caring for Your Spandan 4.0

To ensure the longevity and accuracy of your device:

  • Clean the device by wiping it with a soft cloth.
  • Store the device within the recommended temperature and moisture range.
  • Keep the electrodes in their pouch until ready for use.
  • Do not immerse or expose the device to excessive liquid.
  • Avoid exposing the device to strong electromagnetic fields.


Troubleshooting Common Issues: If you encounter any difficulties while using Spandan 4.0, consider these tips:

  • Ensure your smartphone is compatible with the Spandan ECG app.
  • Check that the OTG connection is enabled on your phone.
  • Verify that the electrodes are fresh and adequately moist.
  • Make sure the device is in a hanging position while taking the ECG.


If problems persist, contact technical support at support@sunfox.in or +91 7060000556.

Important Safety Considerations

  • Spandan 4.0 is intended for adults aged 21 and above.
  • The device is not intended for use in aircraft environments.
  • Do not use the device with a defibrillator or in a magnetic resonance (MR) environment.
  • Always consult your doctor if you have pre-existing heart conditions or experience symptoms like shortness of breath, palpitations, or dizziness.
  • Avoid taking an ECG immediately after drinking cold water, consuming alcohol or caffeine, smoking, or exercising.


Spandan 4.0 brings professional-grade ECG monitoring to your home, empowering you to take a more active role in your heart health. By following this guide and using the device regularly as recommended by your healthcare provider, you can gain valuable insights into your cardiac health. Remember, while home ECG devices are powerful tools, they should complement, not replace, regular check-ups with your doctor. Use Spandan 4.0 as part of a comprehensive approach to heart health, always in consultation with your healthcare professional.
